result.execSummary:
The defendant Jennifer K Lyon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To pay the costs of the action. (costs have been paid in full from cash bond posted).
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

timeConds.notes: Consecutive to 15-CT-041 and 15-CM-172.  Huber release granted.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

defendant.name: Lyon, Jennifer K

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DC Jail petition for sentence modification - Court revokes huber privileges for 30 days.
DC Jail request for sentence modification. Defendant requests one day furlough for medical appointment. Court approves request.

Defendant Jennifer K Lyon in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer.  Defendant Jennifer K Lyon in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.
Defendant in custody.
($1000 of which has already been posted) Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.

Defendant Jennifer K Lyon appeared by video conference. Attorney Linda Jean Schaefer appeared by phone. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews issuance of warrants. State requests forfeiture of all bonds already posted, requests new bonds on all cases. Court will not forfeit bond, adds $1,000 to whatever amount bond is currently set at. All other conditions remain in effect.  Status conference scheduled for June 1, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Jennifer K Lyon not in court.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls case at 2:48 pm, reviews events in file. Atty Schaefer's office spoke to defendant earlier today, had expected her to be here to wrap all matter up. State requests bench warrant. Court orders bench warrant.
for DNA Sample

Defendant Jennifer K Lyon in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty. Atty Schaefer asks court to set off sentencing until mid May. State has no objection. Per request of DA Pelrine, court removes jury trial from the calendar along with jury trial in 15-CT-41 as all matters will be resolved on 5/16/16. Bond remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 16, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Plea hearing at 03-04-2016 11:15 am
Jury trial at 03-22-2016 08:30 am
Pre-trial conference at 03-10-2016 09:30 am

Defendant Jennifer K Lyon in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file. Counsel request that all 5 files that contain bail jumping charges be set for trial on the same day. Court will set 15-CM-172, 15-CM-145, 15-CM-141, 15-CM-125 & 15-CM-192 for trial on the same day. Counsel have no preference if trial is set before or after the OWI trial. Bond remains in effect.

Defendant Jennifer K Lyon in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Schaefer indicates defendant would like a jury trial on all pending cases. Court will set the OWI in 15-CT-41 for trial first, sets status in remaining files for 12/22/15 at 8:00 am. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for December 22, 2015 at 08:00 am.

Defendant Jennifer K Lyon in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, Court Defendant Jennifer K Lyon in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel. Defense waives reading of the complaint, enters not guilty plea. Court finds probable cause for bindover. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 09:45 am.
Defendant was fingerprinted by jail staff. (fingerprint card destroyed)
State's Discovery Demand
Audio/Video Supplementary Discovery Demand
Defense Discovery Demand
Defendant in custody.

Defendant Jennifer K Lyon appears by video conference along with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer who appears in person.  Defendant Jennifer K Lyon in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, questions defendant on missed court appearance. Defendant indicates she had some medical issues going on yesterday. Court cancels bench warrant.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel. State requests additional $500 cash bond. Defense gives argument on bond. Defense feels matters will resolve short of trial, requests a status in 30 days. Court not going to change bond today, remains as previously set. Court indicates, if defendant misses any court in the future, she'll need to have a doctors excuse as to the medical issues going on.  Status conference scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 11:15 am.
Attorney Linda Jean Schaefer in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State requests bench warrant. Defense requests until noon tomorrow. Court issues bench warrant.
Defendant was fingerprinted 8/08/15 by jail staff.
Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant Jennifer K Lyon appears by video conference along with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer who appears in person.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond.  Initial appearance scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 04:00 pm.
